articles.headline: Ohio Voters Reject Constitutional Change Intended to Thwart Abortion Amendment
articles.snippet: The contest was seen as a test of efforts by Republicans nationwide to curb voters’ use of ballot initiatives.
articles.abstract: The contest was seen as a test of efforts by Republicans nationwide to curb voters’ use of ballot initiatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ohio voters rejected a bid on Tuesday to make it harder to amend the State Constitution, according to The Associated Press, a significant victory for abortion-rights supporters trying to stop the Republican-controlled State Legislature from severely restricting the procedure.

articles.headline: Previously Secret Memo Laid Out Strategy for Trump to Overturn Biden’s Win
articles.snippet: The House Jan. 6 committee’s investigation did not uncover the memo, whose existence first came to light in last week’s indictment.
articles.abstract: The House Jan. 6 committee’s investigation did not uncover the memo, whose existence first came to light in last week’s indictment.
articles.lead_paragraph: A lawyer allied with President Donald J. Trump first laid out a plot to use false slates of electors to subvert the 2020 election in a previously unknown internal campaign memo that prosecutors are portraying as a crucial link in how the Trump team’s efforts evolved into a criminal conspiracy.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Charlie Savage and Luke Broadwater

articles.headline: Confusion in Hollywood as Some Productions Are Allowed to Continue
articles.snippet: The striking actors’ union is granting waivers to some projects not affiliated with the major studios, but questions persist about who qualifies and why.
articles.abstract: The striking actors’ union is granting waivers to some projects not affiliated with the major studios, but questions persist about who qualifies and why.
articles.lead_paragraph: When you’re making an independent film every second counts. Ash Avildsen had six days of filming left on his low-budget biopic “Queen of the Ring” — including a climactic scene involving a majority of his cast — when the actors’ union went on strike on July 14.

articles.headline: Maui Town Is Devastated by Deadliest Wildfire to Strike Hawaii
articles.snippet: At least 36 people were killed in fires that tore through Maui and  leveled entire neighborhoods.
articles.abstract: At least 36 people were killed in fires that tore through Maui and  leveled entire neighborhoods.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow live updates on the deadly wildfires in Maui, Hawaii.

articles.headline: This Is a Reminder That You’re Probably Oversharing on Venmo
articles.snippet: The mobile wallet service is a cautionary tale of how apps born at least a decade ago may be exposing more information than you would like.
articles.abstract: The mobile wallet service is a cautionary tale of how apps born at least a decade ago may be exposing more information than you would like.
articles.lead_paragraph: There’s an app for snooping on your friends, family and colleagues to find out about their fancy dinners, the people they are dating and the parties they are attending that you weren’t invited to.

articles.headline: An Overrun Miami Suburb Will Snip Its Peacocks (and Not in the Feathers)
articles.snippet: The birds are breeding and running amok in Pinecrest, Fla. The village will test a novel solution to rein them in: peacock vasectomies.
articles.abstract: The birds are breeding and running amok in Pinecrest, Fla. The village will test a novel solution to rein them in: peacock vasectomies.
articles.lead_paragraph: The prevailing theory about why the peacocks flocked to suburban Pinecrest is that, like many a Floridian, they went hunting for better real estate.
articles.byline: By Patricia Mazzei and Alfonso Duran

articles.headline: China’s Economy Faces Yet Another Threat: Falling Prices
articles.snippet: A deepening slowdown in the world’s second-biggest economy has now raised fears of deflation, which could be crippling for heavily indebted China.
articles.abstract: A deepening slowdown in the world’s second-biggest economy has now raised fears of deflation, which could be crippling for heavily indebted China.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States has spent much of the past 18 months struggling to control inflation. China is experiencing the opposite problem: People and businesses are not spending, pushing the economy to the verge of a pernicious condition called deflation.

articles.headline: Discharging Student Debt in Bankruptcy Is Supposed to Be Easier Than Before
articles.snippet: Last year, the Biden administration provided a new path to make it easier to discharge student loans in bankruptcy. The results appear promising, but success has been limited.
articles.abstract: Last year, the Biden administration provided a new path to make it easier to discharge student loans in bankruptcy. The results appear promising, but success has been limited.
articles.lead_paragraph: Alista Lineburg is not a lawyer, but she assumed the role when she couldn’t find one to help her discharge $146,000 of federal student debt in bankruptcy. The process requires a separate lawsuit against the government, something that many lawyers refuse to take on given the time, expense and difficulty of winning.
